abstract: Verizon Communications neared a deal on Sunday to buy the 45 percent stake in its wireless business held by Vodafone of Britain for about $130 billion, people briefed on the matter said, potentially completing a corporate breakup over a decade in the making.
snippet: Verizon Communications neared a deal on Sunday to buy the 45 percent stake in its wireless business held by Vodafone of Britain for about $130 billion, people briefed on the matter said, potentially completing a corporate breakup over a decade in ...
lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:35 p.m. | Verizon Communications neared a long-anticipated deal on Sunday to buy the 45 percent stake in its wireless business held by Vodafone of Britain for about $130 billion, heralding a continued sweeping realignment within the global telecommunications landscape.

headline.main: Verizon Nears Deal to Buy Out Vodafone’s Stake in Wireless Unit
headline.print_headline: Verizon Nears Deal to Buy Out Vodafone’s Stake in Wireless Unit

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Mark Scott
